jobs.title: Communications Director
jobs.description:
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Develops and manages a comprehensive communications and media relations program to raise the company's visibility (locally, regionally, nationally). Directs overall planning and implementation, including budget development and staff management.
Fosters and enhances relationships with stakeholders to increase awareness of the company's vision, mission, goals and community impact. Serves as the company's primary media contact for news organizations, and advises senior administration and staff in all areas involving media and other external relations vehicles.
Serves as primary marketing liaison for events.
Works with senior administrators and staff to strengthen communications links with the community and governmental agencies and organizations as well as other key constituent groups.
Uses partnerships to create and implement innovative marketing and communication strategies.
Administers special events, marketing and media relations, and participates in other company advancement activities.
Reviews, edits and authorizes copy, and oversees design work on company publications.
Performs other job-related duties as required.


QUALIFICATIONS:

Minimum Qualifications:

5 years progressively responsible experience planning, implementing and evaluating communication strategies. 

Fluent in English, Cantonese and Mandarin

Written and verbal communication skills to communicate complex subjects to groups with various levels of knowledge and experience. 

Knowledge of budgeting practices, including preparing budgets, budget reports/forecast projects and reconciling expenses. 

Experience overseeing a variety of visual communication needs. 

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience working in an environment with multiple demands and short timelines, prioritizing tasks and meeting multiple and conflicting deadlines. 

Knowledge and experience with all aspects of social media communications including strategic planning for various media venues, technical aspects and requirements, and appropriate and effective application. 

Experience using SEO and Google Analytics, building reports, and applying results to improve communications. 

Experience with the principles, practices and techniques of video and photography production for visual storytelling, storyboarding and/or script writing.

To learn more about the organization, please visit http://www.pikaton.com/


Pikaton offers an excellent work environment, competitive salary, and a comprehensive benefits package.
Additionally, we are an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Individuals with Disabilities, and Veterans that values the strength diversity brings to our workplace.

jobs.title: Research/Database Analyst
jobs.description:
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Develop and maintain division survey databases and documentation, such as the Periodic Survey.
Write programs/code for databases as needed.
Operationalize database definitions for survey variables; derive and compute variables for analysis.
Conduct descriptive and multivariate analysis of survey data for presentations, reports, and manuscripts.
Organize and complete survey mailings.
Design tables for data analysis; create graphs for presentations.
Plan and implement the design for fielding multi-stage, random sample surveys.
Perform coding and data entry.
Maintain the electronic library of survey questions and data.
Respond to inquiries regarding survey questions and data.
Provide technical assistance on drawing samples, data file design and usage to other departments upon approval of the supervisor; provide consultation on data collection and statistical testing.
Provide proofreading and accuracy checks for Marketing Services Research surveys, abstracts, presentations, reports, and manuscripts. 
Assist with developing survey questions.
Conduct online surveys, and merge responses with print responses for analysis.
Perform other duties as assigned.

EDUCATION: 
Masters degree in the social sciences or Bachelors degree with extensive experience in survey research required. 

EXPERIENCE: 
Two to three years of survey research experience required, including computer programming and data analysis. ESSENTIAL SKILLS: Proficiency in SPSS required; knowledge of other statistical packages such as R and Stata a plus. Proficiency with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and strong knowledge of general computer software. Must have knowledge of survey field techniques and the ability to work independently and envision analysis needs. Must pay close attention to detail and have excellent organizational and communication skills. Some travel and weekend work may be required.


To learn more about the organization, please visit http://www.pikaton.com/


Pikaton offers an excellent work environment, competitive salary, and a comprehensive benefits package.
Additionally, we are an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Individuals with Disabilities, and Veterans that values the strength diversity brings to our workplace.
